abstract: Kaiser Family Foundation study finds share of employers offering health insurance coverage stayed even in 2016, and cost of premiums for health plans remained mostly unchanged; highlights from survey discussed.

headline.print_headline: Survey Finds Workers Pay a Bigger Share for Health Care
headline.main: Workers Pay More for Health Care as Companies Shift Burden, Survey Finds

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Although premiums haven’t risen significantly, workers’ deductibles and shares of those premiums are going up, the nonprofit Kaiser Family Foundation said....
lead_paragraph: Although premiums haven’t risen significantly, workers’ deductibles and shares of those premiums are going up, the nonprofit Kaiser Family Foundation said.
